meanings.definition: To condemn to a terrible fate or outcome.
meanings.sent1: The witch's curse was dooming the kingdom to darkness.
meanings.sent2: His reckless actions were dooming his chances of success.
meanings.sent3: The cat's habit of knocking over vases seemed to be dooming them all.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathering overhead were dooming the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The ominous prophecy was dooming the hero to a tragic end.

meanings.definition: To make certain to fail or suffer.
meanings.sent1: Her lack of preparation was dooming her presentation to disaster.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring the warning signs was dooming them to repeat their mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The broken compass was dooming them to wander in circles.
meanings.sent4: The leak in the boat was dooming their chances of reaching shore.
meanings.sent5: The virus was dooming the computer to a complete shutdown.

meanings.sent1: The dark clouds dooming rain were gathering in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The economic downturn was dooming many businesses to closure.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller's cryptic words were dooming him to a sleepless night.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's findings were dooming the theory to rejection.
meanings.sent5: The ancient prophecy was dooming the kingdom to destruction.
